availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Martin Fulkerson (Pike County, Kentucky, merchant, quartermaster (U.S.A.))

body.p: Pike County, Kentucky, merchant, soldier. Virginia native. Son of Joseph Fulkerson. Married to Elizabeth Mims Fulkerson in Pike County, Kentucky on January 18, 1847. Father of Susan, Albert, Joseph, Anna, David, and John Fulkerson. Merchant in Pike County, Kentucky in 1850. Merchant in Pike County, Kentucky in 1860. Employed William Ratliff and Sam Morris in the store in Pike County, Kentucky in 1860. Served in 39th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry (U.S.A.) as quartermaster from October 27, 1862 to June 17, 1863. Resigned due to poor health.

ab.bibl:
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 384.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0424.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Pike County Marriages, Film #001943483.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pike, p. 444A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pike, District 1, p. 824.
